Successful RDP logins to systems users w.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4624 and Zeek rdp.log on critical/sensitive systems for RDP login events. Establish a baseline of normal RDP access patterns per user and system using historical data. Identify logins deviating significantly from the baseline using correlation analysis (user vs. system accessed) or descriptive statistics on historical login activity.

RDP logins from a single source system/u.Action: Analyze Windows Event ID 4624 and Zeek rdp.log for successful RDP connections. Group connections by source user and source host within a defined time window (e.g., 30 minutes). Identify instances where a single user/host initiates RDP sessions to a high number of distinct destination hosts within this window using count analysis. Flag connections exceeding a predefined threshold.

RDP sessions initiated from unusual sour.Action: Monitor Zeek rdp.log and Windows Event ID 4624 for successful RDP logins. Extract source IP addresses from logs and, if possible, geolocate them. Compare source IPs and/or geographic locations against a baseline of known or typical RDP sources for specific destination systems or subnets. Flag connections from sources with low frequency of occurrence or high deviation from the established baseline using frequency analysis or percentile calculations.

Suspicious process execution or network.Data: Windows Event ID 4624; Windows Event ID 4688; Windows Event ID 5156; Zeek conn.log
Suspicious process execution or network.Action: Correlate successful RDP login events (Windows Event ID 4624) with subsequent process creation (Windows Event ID 4688) and network connection events (Windows Event ID 5156, Zeek conn.log) on the destination host within a short time window (e.g., 5 minutes). Filter for creation of suspicious processes (e.g., hacking tools, uncommon utilities) or network connections to external/malicious destinations originating from the RDP session logon time. Analyze command lines (4688) and connection details (5156, conn.log) for anomalous patterns.
